title: Starbucks and Union Agree to Framework for Contract Negotiations
author: Dee-Ann Durbin
summary: In a significant breakthrough, Starbucks and the Workers United union have agreed to a process to negotiate contracts, potentially paving the way to resolve a years-long, contentious labor dispute.

title: The 'Buy Now, Pay Later' Industry Faces a Reckoning as Regulators Circle
author: Ananya Bhattacharya
summary: BNPL services like Klarna and Affirm are facing increased scrutiny from consumer protection agencies over concerns about hidden fees and the risk of spiraling debt for users.

title: US Manufacturing Construction Surges, Fueled by CHIPS Act and IRA
author: Josh Wingrove
summary: Federal incentives from the CHIPS Act and Inflation Reduction Act have ignited a factory-building boom across the United States, particularly for semiconductors and electric vehicle batteries.

title: Private Equity Dealmaking Slumps Amid High Interest Rates and Uncertainty
author: Antoine Gara
summary: The volume of private equity buyouts has fallen sharply as expensive debt and valuation disagreements between buyers and sellers have created a challenging environment for dealmakers.

title: The Space Economy: Startups Race to Build the Next Generation of Satellites
author: Michael Sheetz
summary: A new wave of startups is attracting venture capital to build smaller, more advanced satellite constellations for applications ranging from Earth observation to global internet connectivity.

title: Corporate Debt Wall: Trillions in Loans Are Coming Due in a High-Rate World
author: Liz McCormick
summary: Companies that borrowed cheaply over the last decade face a significant challenge as they must now refinance trillions of dollars in debt at much higher interest rates, threatening profitability.

title: Return-to-Office Mandates Meet Resistance as Employee Priorities Shift
author: Chip Cutter
summary: Major corporations are enforcing stricter in-office policies, but face pushback from employees who value the flexibility of remote work, leading to a tense standoff over the future of the workplace.

title: Fast Fashion Giant Shein Faces Renewed Scrutiny Over Labor Practices Ahead of IPO
author: Abha Bhattarai
summary: As online retailer Shein prepares for a potential blockbuster IPO, lawmakers and activists are raising fresh concerns about its opaque supply chain and allegations of forced labor.

title: Automakers Delay EV Targets, Investing in Hybrids as a Bridge Technology
author: Nora Eckert
summary: Several major car manufacturers are revising their EV timelines and increasing investment in hybrid models to cater to consumer demand for fuel efficiency without the range anxiety of pure electrics.

title: The Creator Economy Matures: Focus Shifts from Virality to Sustainable Business Models
author: Taylor Lorenz
summary: Top content creators are moving beyond ad revenue, building diversified businesses with merchandise, subscription services, and direct partnerships to create more stable income streams.

title: The Global Shipping Industry Confronts Decarbonization Challenge
author: Costas Paris
summary: Shipping companies are under pressure to invest billions in new, greener fuels like methanol and ammonia to meet international emissions targets, but the technology and infrastructure are still in early stages.

title: India Emerges as a Key Alternative to China for Tech Manufacturing
author: Samy Adghirni
summary: Companies like Apple and Samsung are significantly expanding their manufacturing operations in India, as global firms seek to de-risk their supply chains and diversify away from China.

title: Office-to-Residential Conversions Prove Costly and Complex
author: Konrad Putzier
summary: While converting empty office buildings into apartments is seen as a solution to housing shortages and high vacancies, developers are finding such projects are often financially unfeasible due to zoning and structural challenges.

title: Corporate Carbon Offsets Under Fire for Failing to Deliver Climate Promises
author: Ben Elgin
summary: Investigations into the carbon offset market reveal that many projects are not delivering the emissions reductions they claim, prompting companies to rethink their climate strategies.

title: The US Dollar's Strength Creates Headwinds for Multinational Corporations
author: Kate Duguid
summary: A persistently strong U.S. dollar is hurting the earnings of American companies that do significant business overseas, as their foreign revenue translates into fewer dollars.

title: Cybersecurity Insurance Premiums Skyrocket Amidst Wave of Ransomware Attacks
author: David Uberti
summary: The cost for businesses to insure themselves against cyberattacks has soared, and insurers are imposing stricter security requirements before they will even offer a policy.

title: The Gig Economy Braces for New Labor Rules on Worker Classification
author: Lauren Kaori Gurley
summary: A new Department of Labor rule makes it more difficult for companies like Uber and DoorDash to classify their workers as independent contractors, a change that could upend their business models.

title: Nuclear Fusion Startups Attract Billions in Private Investment
author: Gregory Barber
summary: Despite the immense scientific challenges, venture capitalists and tech billionaires are pouring money into a new generation of startups aiming to achieve commercial nuclear fusion.

title: DTC Darling or Dud? Many Direct-to-Consumer Brands Struggle with Profitability
author: Hilary Milnes
summary: Many digitally native brands that grew rapidly on social media are now finding it difficult to achieve sustained profitability due to soaring customer acquisition costs.

title: The Global Food Industry Grapples with the High Cost of Cocoa
author: Megan Durisin
summary: Poor harvests in West Africa have sent cocoa prices to record highs, forcing chocolate manufacturers like Hershey and Mondelez to raise prices and shrink product sizes.

title: SaaS Companies Shift Focus from 'Growth at All Costs' to Efficient Operations
author: Alex Wilhelm
summary: The era of cheap capital is over for software-as-a-service companies, who are now under intense pressure from investors to cut costs, streamline operations, and demonstrate a clear path to profitability.

title: Autonomous Trucking Companies Begin Commercial Pilots on US Highways
author: Andrew J. Hawkins
summary: Companies developing self-driving trucks are moving beyond testing and launching commercial pilot programs on major freight corridors, hauling goods for corporate clients with a safety driver present.

title: The Battle for the Dashboard: Automakers and Tech Giants Clash Over In-Car Software
author: Tim Higgins
summary: Car companies are increasingly developing their own in-car operating systems to control user data and create new revenue streams, pushing back against the dominance of Apple CarPlay and Android Auto.

title: Global Tourism Rebounds to Pre-Pandemic Levels, but Spending Patterns Have Changed
author: Hannah Sampson
summary: International travel has fully recovered, but tourists are now prioritizing experiences over goods and are more sensitive to pricing, shifting the dynamics of the travel industry.

title: Vertical Farming Faces a Reality Check as Energy Costs Soar
author: Matt Simon
summary: The high-tech vertical farming industry, once hailed as the future of agriculture, is struggling with high electricity costs and economic viability, leading to bankruptcies and consolidation.

title: The Rise of the Chief AI Officer (CAIO) in the Corporate C-Suite
author: Diane Brady
summary: As companies race to implement artificial intelligence, many are creating a new executive role—the Chief AI Officer—to oversee strategy, ethics, and implementation of AI technologies.

title: Pharmaceutical Industry Under Pressure as Medicare Begins Price Negotiations
author: Bertha Coombs
summary: For the first time, the U.S. government is negotiating the prices of some top-selling drugs for Medicare, a landmark policy that could significantly impact the revenues of major pharmaceutical firms.

title: Fintech Consolidation Heats Up as Startups Seek Scale and Profitability
author: Ryan Browne
summary: With venture funding scarce, many smaller financial technology startups are being acquired by larger, more established players in a wave of consolidation sweeping the industry.

title: US Electric Grid Needs Massive Upgrade to Handle EV and AI Power Demands
author: Jennifer Hiller
summary: The rapid growth of electric vehicles and energy-intensive AI data centers is putting immense strain on the aging U.S. power grid, creating an urgent need for multi-trillion-dollar investments.

title: Corporate America's Skills Gap: Companies Invest in In-House Training and Apprenticeships
author: Vanessa Fuhrmans
summary: Finding qualified workers with specific technical skills remains a major challenge, prompting large companies to create their own training programs and apprenticeships to build their future workforce.

title: The Advertising Market Remains Soft Amid Economic Uncertainty
author: Suzanne Vranica
summary: Brands are remaining cautious with their advertising budgets, leading to a sluggish market for media companies and ad-tech firms that rely on marketing spending.

title: Solid-State Batteries: The Next Frontier for Electric Vehicles?
author: William Wilkes
summary: Automakers and startups are in a fierce race to commercialize solid-state batteries, which promise longer range, faster charging, and improved safety compared to current lithium-ion technology.

title: Emerging Market Debt Becomes a Growing Concern for the Global Economy
author: Colby Smith
summary: Several developing nations are at high risk of debt distress due to a combination of high interest rates, a strong dollar, and slowing economic growth, posing a risk to global financial stability.

title: Biotech Funding Shows Signs of Life After a Prolonged Slump
author: Damian Garde
summary: After a deep two-year downturn, venture capital investment in the biotechnology sector is beginning to rebound, especially for companies in promising fields like obesity and gene editing.

title: The Pet Economy Boom Cools as Consumers Cut Back on Discretionary Spending
author: Sarah Nassauer
summary: After a pandemic-fueled surge, spending on premium pet food, toys, and services is slowing as inflation-conscious consumers pull back on non-essential purchases for their pets.

title: CRISPR-Based Therapy Shows Success in Lowering 'Bad' Cholesterol in First Human Trial
author: Sharon Begley
summary: A single-dose gene-editing therapy has successfully and durably lowered LDL cholesterol in a small human trial, signaling a potential new paradigm for preventing heart disease.

title: Antibiotic Resistance Dubbed a 'Silent Pandemic' as Common Infections Become Untreatable
author: Maryn McKenna
summary: Public health officials are issuing stark warnings as the pipeline for new antibiotics runs dry, while drug-resistant bacteria are causing a growing number of deaths worldwide.

title: Smartwatch ECG Feature Credited with Early Detection of Atrial Fibrillation
author: Nicole Wetsman
summary: A large-scale study confirms that wearable devices can effectively screen for atrial fibrillation, a common heart arrhythmia, allowing for earlier intervention and stroke prevention.

title: Shortages of ADHD Medications Like Adderall Persist, Leaving Patients Scrambling
author: Roni Caryn Rabin
summary: Ongoing manufacturing delays and soaring demand have created a chronic shortage of key ADHD drugs, causing significant disruption for millions of patients who rely on them.

title: The Health Debate Over Daylight Saving Time: Experts Favor a Permanent Standard Time
author: Beth Mole
summary: Sleep scientists and medical associations argue that the annual switch to daylight saving time disrupts circadian rhythms and is linked to increased risks of heart attacks and accidents.

title: AI Accelerates Drug Discovery, Cutting Years Off Development Timelines
author: Emily Mullin
summary: Pharmaceutical companies are leveraging artificial intelligence to identify new drug targets and predict molecular behavior, dramatically speeding up the preclinical phases of research.

title: Maternal Mortality Rates in the U.S. Continue to Rise, Disparities Worsen
author: Megan Schmidt
summary: A new CDC report reveals that the rate of maternal deaths in the United States has continued to climb, with Black and Indigenous women facing a risk several times higher than that of white women.

title: Liquid Biopsy' Blood Tests Show Promise for Multi-Cancer Early Detection
author: Daniela Hernandez
summary: Researchers are optimistic about the potential of blood tests that can screen for dozens of types of cancer simultaneously by detecting DNA fragments shed by tumors.

title: PFAS 'Forever Chemicals' in Drinking Water Linked to a Host of Health Problems
author: Darryl Fears
summary: Mounting evidence connects exposure to PFAS chemicals, which are widespread in U.S. water systems, to kidney cancer, immune system dysfunction, and developmental issues.

title: World's First Malaria Vaccine Rollout Begins in Africa, a Landmark Public Health Moment
author: Jason Beaubien
summary: The first-ever vaccine against malaria is being administered to children in Ghana, Malawi, and Kenya, a historic step in the fight against a disease that kills hundreds of thousands annually.

title: The Rise of Drug-Resistant Fungi Poses a New Global Health Threat
author: Apoorva Mandavilli
summary: Invasive fungal infections, such as Candida auris, are becoming more common and harder to treat, with experts concerned about their spread in healthcare settings.

title: Physician Burnout and Shortages Reach Critical Point in Primary Care
author: Phil Galewitz
summary: A combination of administrative burden, an aging workforce, and insufficient residency slots is creating a severe shortage of primary care doctors, impacting patient access to basic healthcare.

title: New Research Explores How Gut Bacteria Influence Anxiety and Depression
author: Moises Velasquez-Manoff
summary: Scientists are uncovering the complex ways the gut microbiome communicates with the brain, opening up potential new avenues for treating mood disorders through probiotics and diet.

title: The Health Impact of Noise Pollution: More Than Just Annoyance
author: Sarah Zhang
summary: Chronic exposure to noise from traffic and urban environments is linked to a higher risk of hypertension, heart disease, and cognitive impairment, research shows.

title: FDA Approves New RSV Vaccine for Older Adults Ahead of Respiratory Virus Season
author: Amanda D'Ambrosio
summary: A new vaccine to protect adults aged 60 and older from Respiratory Syncytial Virus (RSV), a common virus that can cause severe illness in the elderly, has received FDA approval.

title: Xenotransplantation Advances as Pig Kidney Functions in Brain-Dead Patient for Over a Month
author: Linda Geddes
summary: In a major step forward for cross-species organ transplantation, a genetically modified pig kidney has continued to function normally for a record 32 days in a human recipient.

title: Debate Intensifies Over E-Cigarette Flavors and Their Role in Youth Vaping
author: Sheila Kaplan
summary: Public health advocates are pushing for a federal ban on all flavored e-cigarette products, arguing they are a key driver of the youth vaping epidemic, while opponents claim they help adults quit smoking.

title: Medical Misinformation on Social Media Endangers Public Health, Surgeon General Warns
author: Donell Harvin
summary: The U.S. Surgeon General has issued an advisory on the urgent threat of health misinformation, calling on tech platforms to take more aggressive action to curb its spread.

title: The Link Between Poor Dental Health and Systemic Diseases Like Diabetes and Heart Disease
author: Dana G. Smith
summary: Research increasingly shows that chronic inflammation from gum disease can contribute to and worsen conditions throughout the body, including cardiovascular disease and diabetes.

title: Childhood Food Allergies Are on the Rise; Researchers Investigate Why
author: Meghan Rosen
summary: The prevalence of food allergies in children has increased dramatically in recent decades, with scientists exploring the 'hygiene hypothesis' and the role of the microbiome as potential causes.

title: The Science of Longevity: Researchers Identify Cellular Hallmarks of Aging
author: Carl Zimmer
summary: Scientists have identified key biological processes that drive aging, such as genomic instability and cellular senescence, leading to new drug development aimed at extending human healthspan.

title: Mental Health Parity Laws Are Failing, Leaving Patients with Huge Bills
author: Lesley McClurg
summary: Despite laws requiring insurers to cover mental healthcare equally to physical healthcare, a government report finds that insurance companies routinely and improperly deny mental health claims.

title: Air Pollution Particles Found in Brains, Raising Concerns About Dementia Risk
author: Max G. Levy
summary: New studies using advanced imaging techniques have shown that ultrafine particulate matter from air pollution can cross the blood-brain barrier, potentially triggering inflammation linked to Alzheimer's disease.

title: Robotic Surgery Becomes Standard for More Procedures, But Questions on Cost Remain
author: Christina Farr
summary: Robot-assisted surgery is now common for procedures like prostatectomies and hysterectomies, offering precision and faster recovery, but its high cost remains a significant barrier for many hospitals.

title: The Impact of Excessive Screen Time on Toddler Brain Development
author: Perri Klass, M.D.
summary: A study published in JAMA Pediatrics finds that higher levels of screen time in toddlers are associated with differences in brain structure and poorer language and literacy skills.

title: Global Polio Eradication Effort Faces Final Hurdles in Pakistan and Afghanistan
author: Joanne Silberner
summary: After decades of work, wild poliovirus is now only endemic in two countries, but vaccine hesitancy and political instability are complicating the final push to eradicate the disease.

title: Community Health Workers Bridge Gaps in Care for Underserved Populations
author: Bram Sable-Smith
summary: A growing movement is integrating trusted local community health workers into the healthcare system to help patients navigate complex services and manage chronic conditions.

title: Advancements in Prosthetics: Mind-Controlled Limbs Offer New Hope for Amputees
author: David Cox
summary: Next-generation prosthetic limbs that integrate with the user's nervous system are allowing for more intuitive, thought-driven control and even a sense of touch.

title: Preventative Care: Why a Small Investment Can Yield Huge Health Savings
author: Aaron E. Carroll
summary: Economists and public health experts argue that increased investment in preventative services like screenings and vaccinations is highly cost-effective and leads to better long-term health outcomes.

title: GLP-1 Drugs Studied for Potential to Treat Addiction and Compulsive Behaviors
author: Yasemin Saplakoglu
summary: Beyond weight loss, researchers are now investigating whether drugs like Ozempic and Wegovy can curb cravings and reduce addictive behaviors related to alcohol, nicotine, and gambling.

title: New Blood Test Could Predict Preeclampsia Risk in Pregnant Women
author: Jen Christensen
summary: The FDA has cleared a new blood test that can help doctors identify pregnant women at high risk of developing preeclampsia, a dangerous high-blood-pressure condition.

title: The Promise and Peril of At-Home Medical Testing Kits
author: Rachel Fairbank
summary: The market for direct-to-consumer health tests for everything from food sensitivity to hormones is booming, but experts caution about the lack of regulation and potential for misinterpretation.

title: Hospitals Overwhelmed by 'Boarding' Crisis as Psychiatric Bed Shortage Worsens
author: Anna Gorman
summary: Patients experiencing a mental health crisis are being held ('boarded') in emergency rooms for days or weeks due to a severe nationwide shortage of inpatient psychiatric beds.

title: Regular Napping Linked to Higher Risk of High Blood Pressure and Stroke
author: Katie Hunt
summary: A large study published by the American Heart Association found that frequent, long naps were associated with a greater likelihood of developing hypertension and having a stroke.

title: Scientists Grow Human Embryo Models Without Sperm or Egg, Raising Ethical Questions
author: Megan Molteni
summary: Researchers have created synthetic human embryo-like structures from stem cells that mimic the earliest stages of development, a breakthrough that also prompts a new debate on bioethics.

title: Congress Averts Government Shutdown with Last-Minute Stopgap Bill
author: Carl Hulse
summary: Lawmakers passed a short-term funding measure just hours before a deadline, temporarily avoiding a partial government shutdown but setting up another fiscal cliff in several weeks.

title: FTC Sues to Block Major Supermarket Merger, Citing Antitrust Concerns
author: David McLaughlin
summary: The Federal Trade Commission filed a lawsuit to stop the proposed $24.6 billion merger between Kroger and Albertsons, arguing the deal would lead to higher food prices for consumers and harm workers.

title: US and UK Launch Coordinated Airstrikes Against Houthi Targets in Yemen
author: Nancy A. Youssef
summary: In response to ongoing attacks on international shipping, U.S. and British forces conducted a new round of strikes on Houthi military sites, aiming to degrade the group's capabilities.

title: Presidential Primary Debate Focuses on Economy and Foreign Policy
author: Seung Min Kim
summary: Candidates clashed over inflation, national debt, and America's role in global conflicts during the latest televised debate, seeking to differentiate themselves ahead of key primary contests.

title: State Department Issues 'Level 4: Do Not Travel' Advisory for Haiti Amidst Gang Violence
author: Michael Weissenstein
summary: The U.S. government has urged all American citizens to leave Haiti immediately, citing extreme kidnapping risks and the near-total collapse of security as armed gangs control large parts of the capital.

title: Bipartisan TikTok Divestment Bill Gains Momentum in the House
author: David Shepardson
summary: A bill that would force TikTok's Chinese parent company, ByteDance, to sell the app or face a U.S. ban is rapidly advancing with support from both Democrats and Republicans over national security concerns.

title: Supreme Court Appears Skeptical of State Laws Regulating Social Media Content
author: Adam Liptak
summary: During oral arguments, justices from across the ideological spectrum questioned the constitutionality of laws in Texas and Florida that seek to limit how social media platforms moderate content.

title: Pentagon Fails its Sixth Consecutive Audit, Unable to Account for Half its Assets
author: Tony Capaccio
summary: The Department of Defense has once again failed its annual audit, highlighting ongoing systemic issues with financial tracking and accountability for trillions of dollars in assets.

title: Germany's Ruling Coalition in Disarray Over Ukraine Military Aid
author: Erika Solomon
summary: Chancellor Olaf Scholz is facing intense pressure from his coalition partners and allies to send long-range Taurus missiles to Ukraine, a move he has so far resisted, creating deep rifts in his government.

title: US-EU Trade Tensions Resurface Over Steel and Aluminum Tariffs
author: Shawn Donnan
summary: Negotiations between the United States and the European Union to resolve a dispute over metal tariffs have stalled, raising the prospect of a renewed trade war that could impact billions in goods.

title: Florida Legislature Passes Controversial Bill Restricting School Library Books
author: Ana Ceballos
summary: The state legislature approved a bill that makes it easier for parents to challenge books in school libraries, a move critics say amounts to censorship and targets LGBTQ+ and minority authors.

title: Senate Intelligence Committee Warns of Russian Interference in 2024 Election
author: Julian E. Barnes
summary: In its annual threat assessment, the committee stated that Russia remains a critical and persistent threat, using disinformation campaigns and cyber operations to sow discord and influence U.S. elections.

title: White House Announces New Sanctions on Iran Over its Drone Program
author: John Hudson
summary: The Biden administration imposed new economic sanctions targeting individuals and entities involved in Iran's drone manufacturing, which has supplied unmanned aerial vehicles to Russia for use in Ukraine.

title: Debate Over Foreign Aid for Ukraine Divides Republican Party
author: Jake Sherman
summary: A supplemental funding package for Ukraine, Israel, and Taiwan is facing significant opposition from a faction of House Republicans, highlighting a growing isolationist sentiment within the party.

title: Federal Court Strikes Down Alabama's Congressional Map for Diluting Black Vote
author: Ariane de Vogue
summary: A panel of federal judges rejected Alabama's newly drawn congressional map, ruling that it likely violates the Voting Rights Act by failing to create a second majority-Black district.

title: Presidential Executive Order Aims to Bolster U.S. Supply Chain Resilience
author: Ana Swanson
summary: The president signed an executive order directing federal agencies to conduct a 100-day review of critical supply chains for semiconductors, pharmaceuticals, and rare-earth minerals.

title: South Africa's Ruling ANC Party Faces Toughest Election Challenge Since Apartheid
author: John Eligon
summary: Polls indicate that the African National Congress could lose its parliamentary majority for the first time since Nelson Mandela's victory in 1994, amid voter frustration over corruption and a weak economy.

title: US-China Diplomatic Talks Resume, Aiming to Stabilize Tense Relationship
author: Edward Wong
summary: High-level officials from Washington and Beijing met for candid discussions on a range of contentious issues, including trade, Taiwan, and fentanyl, in an effort to manage competition and prevent conflict.

title: Student Loan Forgiveness Plan Faces New Legal Challenges from Republican States
author: Collin Binkley
summary: A coalition of Republican-led states has filed a new lawsuit seeking to block the Biden administration's latest student debt relief plan, arguing it oversteps executive authority.

title: The Geopolitics of the Arctic: Nations Vie for Control as Ice Melts
author: Paul Sonne
summary: With climate change opening new shipping lanes and access to resources, the Arctic is becoming a new front for strategic competition between Russia, China, and NATO allies.

title: House Ethics Committee Launches Investigation into Lawmaker's Stock Trades
author: Melanie Zanona
summary: The bipartisan ethics panel has opened a formal inquiry into a member of Congress over allegations of using nonpublic information to make timely stock trades in the defense sector.

title: EPA Finalizes Stricter Rules on Soot Pollution to Improve Public Health
author: Dino Grandoni
summary: The Environmental Protection Agency announced a new, more stringent standard for fine particulate matter (soot), a move the agency says will prevent thousands of premature deaths annually.

title: Immigration Reform Talks Collapse in Senate Amid Partisan Finger-Pointing
author: Burgess Everett
summary: A month-long bipartisan effort to craft a deal on border security and immigration reform has fallen apart, dashing hopes for a legislative solution to the crisis at the southern border.

title: Japan's Prime Minister Grapples with Political Funding Scandal
author: Michelle Ye Hee Lee
summary: Prime Minister Fumio Kishida's approval ratings have plummeted as a widening fundraising scandal engulfs his ruling Liberal Democratic Party, leading to the arrest of several lawmakers.

title: Department of Homeland Security Designates AI as a Critical National Security Risk
author: Ellen Nakashima
summary: DHS has released a new strategy document outlining the potential for adversaries to use artificial intelligence for cyberattacks, disinformation campaigns, and the creation of chemical weapons.

title: The Role of 'Dark Money' in Judicial Nominations Comes Under Scrutiny
author: Heidi Przybyla
summary: Senate Democrats are holding hearings on the influence of undisclosed donations to nonprofit groups that advocate for and against federal judicial nominees.

title: Farmers Across Europe Protest Against EU Green Policies and Cheap Imports
author: Matina Stevis-Gridneff
summary: Convoys of tractors have blocked highways in France, Germany, and Belgium as farmers protest against environmental regulations, rising costs, and what they say is unfair competition from Ukrainian imports.

title: US Postal Service Modernization Plan Faces Bipartisan Opposition in Congress
author: Jacob Bogage
summary: Postmaster General Louis DeJoy's 10-year overhaul plan is facing criticism from lawmakers on both sides of the aisle over mail delivery delays and the consolidation of processing facilities.

title: Mexican President's Proposed Constitutional Reforms Spark Controversy
author: Dave Graham
summary: President Andrés Manuel López Obrador has proposed sweeping changes to Mexico's constitution, including an overhaul of the judiciary, which critics warn would erode democratic checks and balances.

title: The Filibuster Debate Reignites in the Senate as Gridlock Persists
author: Sahil Kapur
summary: With major legislation stalled, progressive Democrats are once again calling for an end to the Senate's 60-vote threshold, arguing it is an obstacle to passing key priorities.

title: US Re-designates Houthis as a Terrorist Organization
author: Missy Ryan
summary: The Biden administration has formally relisted Yemen's Houthi rebels as a 'Specially Designated Global Terrorist' group, a move that triggers sanctions but includes carve-outs for humanitarian aid.

title: State Legislatures Increasingly Use Preemption Laws to Overrule Local Ordinances
author: Reid Wilson
summary: A growing trend sees state governments passing broad laws that prevent cities and counties from enacting their own policies on issues ranging from minimum wage to environmental protection.

title: North Korea Abandons Goal of Reconciliation with South, Declares It 'Enemy State'
author: Choe Sang-Hun
summary: Kim Jong Un has formally rejected the long-standing goal of peaceful reunification with South Korea, ordering the demolition of monuments to inter-Korean cooperation and escalating military tensions.

title: The CBO's Dire Long-Term Budget Outlook: A Ticking Debt Bomb
author: Heather Long
summary: The Congressional Budget Office released its latest projections, warning that the national debt is on an unsustainable path, projected to reach a record 116% of GDP within a decade.

title: Biden Administration Restores Endangered Species Act Protections
author: Lisa Friedman
summary: The Interior Department finalized rules that reverse Trump-era changes, restoring longstanding protections for threatened species and once again considering climate change as a factor in listing decisions.
